result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin Michael Smart

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on December 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
8:39 AM Defendant Kevin Michael Smart in court.  Attorney Renee M Taber appeared by video for Kevin Michael Smart.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Counsel indicates DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing, but request preliminary hearing to be set.  Court enters NG Plea to Count 2.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:14 AM DE Kevin Smartin court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Alysja Otten (special appearance) in court. Bruce R Poquette appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE does not qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Otten argues bond conditions.  Court sets bond.  SIBS $2500  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.  Court gives the DE the attorney colloquy. Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for  at 8:30AM.
Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
